text: We had our reunion lunch last Sunday. It was recommended by my sis in law. Never expected that the food here is so nice. The best is the curry fish head, coffee pork rib, cereal prawn, fried chicken…
Great food especially the curry fish head, patient, polite, helpful, provided paper plates and candles for our birthday cake. 5 stars service.

Surprisingly I enjoyed my visit a lot more this year. Special mention to the Loh Hei and Coffee Pork! It’s amazingly my absolute favourite! Can’t find elsewhere where they can make it better. Size of Lou hei could be bigger as it was barely enough for 8 pax, but the taste was oh so on point! Also the coffee pork is well seasoned and oh so umami without being too overpowering. The other dishes are fine and slight above average. Only gripe is the that cereal prawns was served with frozen prawns, the texture is very bouncy for some reason and not in a good way. Hopefully they can opt to get better quality prawns as it’s not exactly affordable to dine here in the first place haha
I was blown away by the deliciousness of their signature coffee pork ribs. They tasted even better than I expected. The other dishes were also very good, and the service was quick.

Service staff is friendly. We ordered hor fun with gravy, spinach with 3 different eggs and prawn roll. Very satisfying meals especially the veg dish and wok hei hor fun. Sat outdoor and it was breezy.
